div.p: Greetings. I have received everything you sent, dearest brother, and I hope you have already received the same in part, which you sent to me. What friends have sent in the meantime, you have enclosed here, which I send to you as they were sent to me. Believe as much as you wish.
I cannot write more, being so overwhelmed with business. Therefore, forgive me and farewell forever. Zurich, January 5, 1569.
Greet the honorable consuls, Mr. Karl, Pontasella, Ganthner, and other brothers and friends.
To the most distinguished man, Mr. Tobias Egli, minister of the church in Chur, my esteemed lord and dearest brother.
